attributes.action: Epsom and Ewell has 52% remain, so call on Chris Grayling to stand down.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a solid wall of "Remain" amongst voters from Central London through to Brighton which includes most of Surrey (Mr Grayling's county). 

The turn out in the local area is well above the national average (England 73.0%, UK 72.2%) :

Epsom and Ewell, turnout 80.4%
Mole Valley, remain 53.1% turnout 82.1%
Elmbridge, remain 59.5%  turnout 78.1%
Kingston upon Thames, remain  61.6% turnout 78.3% 
(Epsom and Ewell's postcode is KT)
attributes.background: The people of the constituency of Epsom and Ewell (and surrounds) feel that the Brexit campaigner, Rt Hon Chris Grayling MP, does not represent the view of his constituency (remain  52.1%) and call on him to stand down.

rejection.details: The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for removing MPs from office because of their views or opinions. Any decision on whether to stand down would be a personal matter for Mr Grayling.
